Two pnats are coprime if their gcd is 1.

name: PNat.Coprime
docString: Two pnats are coprime if their gcd is 1.

A prime number is coprime with another natural number if and only if it does not divide that number.

name: Nat.Prime.coprime_iff_not_dvd
docString: A prime number is coprime with another natural number if and only if it does not divide that number.

The theorem `Nat.prime_two` asserts that the number 2 is a prime number. In the context of natural numbers, a prime number is defined as a natural number greater than or equal to 2 whose only divisors are itself and 1. Therefore, this theorem is confirming that 2, which is divisible only by itself and 1, satisfies this property and is therefore a prime number.

name: Nat.prime_two
docString: The theorem `Nat.prime_two` asserts that the number 2 is a prime number. In the context of natural numbers, a prime number is defined as a natural number greater than or equal to 2 whose only divisors are itself and 1. Therefore, this theorem is confirming that 2, which is divisible only by itself and 1, satisfies this property and is therefore a prime number.

The type of prime numbers

name: Nat.Primes
docString: The type of prime numbers

The set of prime factors of the product of two natural numbers is equal to the union of the sets of prime factors of each number.

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, a ≠ 0 → b ≠ 0 → (a * b).primeFactors = a.primeFactors ∪ b.primeFactors
name: Nat.primeFactors_mul
docString: The set of prime factors of the product of two natural numbers is equal to the union of the sets of prime factors of each number.

This theorem states that for any two non-zero natural numbers `a` and `b`, the set of prime factors of their product `a * b` is equal to the union of the sets of prime factors of `a` and `b`. In other words, the prime factors of the product of two numbers are precisely the prime factors of the individual numbers.

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, a ≠ 0 → b ≠ 0 → (a * b).primeFactors = a.primeFactors ∪ b.primeFactors
name: Nat.primeFactors_mul
docString: This theorem states that for any two non-zero natural numbers `a` and `b`, the set of prime factors of their product `a * b` is equal to the union of the sets of prime factors of `a` and `b`. In other words, the prime factors of the product of two numbers are precisely the prime factors of the individual numbers.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

name: Nat.dvd_right_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

Two prime powers with positive exponents are equal only when the primes and the
exponents are equal.

type: ∀ {p q m n : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → Nat.Prime q → p ^ (m + 1) = q ^ (n + 1) → p = q ∧ m = n
name: Nat.Prime.pow_inj
docString:
Two prime powers with positive exponents are equal only when the primes and the
exponents are equal.

The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

type: ∀ {a b x y u v : ℕ}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 → ∃ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2
name: Nat.sq_add_sq_mul
docString: The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

name: Nat.primeFactors
docString: The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

The Mersenne numbers, 2^p - 1.

name: mersenne
docString: The Mersenne numbers, 2^p - 1.

For coprime `a` and `b`, the prime factors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b`

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, Nat.Coprime a b → List.Perm (Nat.factors (a * b)) (Nat.factors a ++ Nat.factors b)
name: Nat.perm_factors_mul_of_coprime
docString: For coprime `a` and `b`, the prime factors of `a * b` are the union of those of `a` and `b`

A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

name: GaussianInt.prime_iff_mod_four_eq_three_of_nat_prime
docString: A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

The multiset consisting of a single prime

name: PrimeMultiset.ofPrime
docString: The multiset consisting of a single prime

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

Two positive naturals are equal if their prime padic valuations are equal

type: ∀ (a b : ℕ), a ≠ 0 → b ≠ 0 → (a = b ↔ ∀ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p → padicValNat p a = padicValNat p b)
name: Nat.eq_iff_prime_padicValNat_eq
docString: Two positive naturals are equal if their prime padic valuations are equal

The product of two two-pointings.

type: {α : Type u_1} → {β : Type u_2} → TwoPointing α → TwoPointing β → TwoPointing (α × β)
name: TwoPointing.prod
docString: The product of two two-pointings.

A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`.

name: Nat.Prime.mod_two_eq_one_iff_ne_two
docString: A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`.

An inequality involving `2`.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrderedField α] {a : α}, 2 ≤ a → (1 - 1 / a)⁻¹ ≤ 2
name: sub_one_div_inv_le_two
docString: An inequality involving `2`.

Two points are collinear.

type:
∀ (k : Type u_1) {V : Type u_2} {P : Type u_3} [inst : DivisionRing k] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module k V]
  [inst_3 : AddTorsor V P] (p₁ p₂ : P), Collinear k {p₁, p₂}
name: collinear_pair
docString: Two points are collinear.

Right duals are isomorphic.

type:
{C : Type u₁} →
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{v₁, u₁} C] →
    [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategory C] →
      {X Y₁ Y₂ : C} → CategoryTheory.ExactPairing X Y₁ → CategoryTheory.ExactPairing X Y₂ → (Y₁ ≅ Y₂)
name: CategoryTheory.rightDualIso
docString: Right duals are isomorphic.

The two points of a bipointed type, bundled together as a pair of distinct elements.

name: TwoP.toTwoPointing
docString: The two points of a bipointed type, bundled together as a pair of distinct elements.

The numerator and denominator are coprime: it is in "reduced form".

name: Rat.reduced
docString: The numerator and denominator are coprime: it is in "reduced form".
